intro: Euphrasia tatrae, commonly known as the Tatra eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Euphrasia tatrae is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in the ecological diversity of its high-altitude environment.
